definition: to burn the midnight oil (idiom); to work continuously night and day
to burn
ointment/paste/CL:帖[tie3]
to moisten/to grease/to apply (cream, ointment)/to dip a brush in ink
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards
sundial
to dress before light and not eat before dark (idiom)/diligently attending to official matters
diligently
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to rise early and sleep late (idiom); to work hard/to study diligently/to burn the candle at both ends
incessant/relentless
assiduously
to study assiduously and tirelessly (idiom)/see also 頭懸梁，錐刺股|头悬梁，锥刺股[tou2 xuan2 liang2 , zhui1 ci4 gu3]
lit. to spit out one's heart and spill blood (idiom)/to work one's heart out/blood, sweat and tears
see 廢寢忘食|废寝忘食[fei4 qin3 wang4 shi2]
diligent and tireless (idiom)
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
lit. always with a book in hand (idiom)/fig. (of a student or scholar) diligent and hardworking
to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
lit. to hang one's books on cow horns (idiom)/fig. to be diligent in one's studies
lit. with his head attached to a beam and stabbing his thigh with an awl (idiom)/fig. to study assiduously and tirelessly
pinyin: tou2 xuan2 liang2 , zhui1 ci4 gu3

definition: to make an effort/to push for sth/to work hard
